Security Practices

Learn about our robust security measures and compliance standards

TABLE OF CONTENTS
Quick Links

Related Documents

Last updated: December 2024

We take the security of customer data very seriously at Greptile. If you have additional questions regarding security, we are happy to answer them. Please write to security@greptile.com and we will respond as quickly as we can. This page describes the administrative, technical, and physical controls applicable to Greptile.

Quick Links
Terms of Service
Privacy Policy
Subprocessors

Data Processing Agreement (DPA): Available on request. Contact security@greptile.com to obtain a copy.

Hosting and Architecture

Greptile is available as either a cloud-based or on-prem ("bring-your-own-cloud") service.

Cloud-based (hosted) services

The infrastructure for Greptile is provided and hosted by Amazon Web Services, Inc. ("AWS") and Microsoft Azure. Information about security provided by AWS is available from the AWS Security website. For Azure security information, please visit the Microsoft Azure Security page.

Greptile uses both OpenAI and Anthropic's API platforms for AI inference. Information about their security practices can be found at the OpenAI Enterprise Privacy page and the Anthropic Commercial Terms page.

A complete list of third-party service providers that process Customer Data is available on our Subprocessors page. These providers are essential to delivering Greptile's services and are bound by strict data protection requirements and security controls.

On-premises (self-hosted) services

For self-hosted Greptile services, Custom Apps are hosted using your own infrastructure - such as on-premises - so that you and your users can build, run, and, use Greptile in your virtual private cloud (VPC) or behind your virtual private network (VPN). In provisioning a self-hosted account of the Greptile services, our self-hosted image is built with the latest upstream version of Amazon Linux (Greptile's base operating system image) with the latest security patches and updates.

Large Language Model (LLM) Inference

Customers that choose to self-host Greptile can choose to also self-host LLMs instead of using OpenAI's API Platform for inference. Customer can also "bring their own LLM" by inserting their own base URL and keys.

Storage of Customer Code

Greptile stores customer code on an encrypted filesystem on our servers. Code remains cached on our machines until access is revoked in GitHub or GitLab, at which point it is deleted from our servers. Access to the code is tightly controlled and used only to provide the services you have opted into. Greptile also stores vector embeddings of file paths, documentation, and AI-generated docstrings in a vector database.

For customers using our cloud-based version, code storage occurs on AWS services provisioned by Greptile. If a customer chooses the on-premises option, their code never leaves their servers or their provisioned cloud environment.

Storage of Customer Data

Greptile stores logs of customer chats in an AWS DynamoDB database. Members of the Greptile team may access these chat logs in order to provide technical support. Customers can choose to turn off logging and make chats 100% private. Note that in the self-hosted service, logs are stored on customer servers only.

Machine Learning and Data Usage
De-Identified Data and AI Training

Greptile may aggregate and anonymize Customer Data ("De-Identified Data") for analytical purposes and to monitor, improve, or expand our services, and may use such data to train and improve artificial intelligence algorithms and models ("AI Training and Learnings").

Greptile will implement appropriate measures and controls designed to remove personally identifiable information, customer-specific references, and sensitive data from De-Identified Data and AI Training and Learnings. Greptile will solely and exclusively own the De-Identified Data and AI Training and Learnings (but not the underlying Customer Data).

Opting Out of AI Training

If you do not wish to permit Greptile to engage in AI training, you may manage preferences and settings related to AI training within your account on the Platform, and Greptile will thereafter cease further AI training. For questions about opting out or managing your AI training preferences, please contact security@greptile.com.

For customers using our self-hosted solution, no Customer Data is collected or processed for machine learning purposes unless explicitly configured by the customer.

Confidentiality and Security Controls
Confidentiality

Greptile places strict controls over its employees' access to Customer Data. The operation of the Greptile requires that some employees have access to the systems which store or process this information and data.

For example, in order to diagnose a problem the customer are having with the Greptile services, we may need to access the customer's account. These employees are prohibited from using these permissions to view Customer Data unless it is necessary to do so. We have technical controls and audit policies in place to ensure that any access to the customer account is logged.

All of our employees and contract personnel are bound to our policies regarding confidentiality and we treat these issues as matters of the highest importance within our company.

Return and deletion of customer data

Within 30 days following any termination or expiration, Customer may request return of Customer Data stored by Greptile (to the extent such data has not already been deleted by Customer).

Greptile provides the option for administrators to delete all Customer Data stored by Greptile at any time during a subscription term. Within 24 hours of administrator-initiated deletion, Greptile hard deletes all Customer Data from currently running production systems. Greptile-maintained backups of services and data may be destroyed within 30 days (backups are destroyed within 30 days, except that during an on-going investigation of an incident such period may be temporarily extended).

Monitoring and Validation
Certificates

Greptile is SOC2 Type II compliant. Customers may download a copy of Greptile's SOC2 Type II report by reaching out to security@greptile.com.

At a minimum, Greptile will align with prevailing industry standards such as SOC 2 Type II, or any successor or superseding standard.

Audits

To verify that our security practices are sound and to monitor the Greptile services for new vulnerabilities discovered by the security research community, the Greptile services undergo security assessments by internal personnel, and for the Greptile services by respected external security firms who perform regular audits of the Greptile services. In addition to periodic and targeted audits of the Greptile services, we also employ the use of continuous hybrid automated scanning of our web platform. Customers may download a copy of available applicable external audit reports by reaching out to security@greptile.com.

Personnel

Greptile conducts background checks on all employees before employment, and employees receive privacy and security training during onboarding as well as on an ongoing basis. All employees are required to read and sign our comprehensive information security policy covering the security, availability, and confidentiality of the Greptile services.

Related Documents
Terms of Service - Our service agreement
Privacy Policy - How we handle personal information
Subprocessors - Third-party data processors
Data Processing Agreement - Available on request (contact security@greptile.com)

For any other questions, please feel free to reach out to security@greptile.com, and we will get right back to you.

blog-content"><p class="text-sm text-tertiary">Last updated: December 2024</p><p>We take the security of customer data very seriously at Greptile. If you have additional questions regarding security, we are happy to answer them. Please write to <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="mailto:security@greptile.com">security@greptile.com</a> and we will respond as quickly as we can. This page describes the administrative, technical, and physical controls applicable to Greptile.</p><h2 id="quick-links">Quick Links</h2><div class="flex flex-wrap gap-3 not-prose"><a class="text-sm"><strong>Data Processing Agreement (DPA):</strong> Available on request. Contact<!-- --> <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="mailto:security@greptile.com">security@greptile.com</a> to obtain a copy.</p><h2 id="hosting-and-architecture">Hosting and Architecture</h2><p>Greptile is available as either a cloud-based or on-prem ("bring-your-own-cloud") service.</p><h3 id="cloud-based-hosted-services">Cloud-based (hosted) services</h3><p>The infrastructure for Greptile is provided and hosted by Amazon Web Services, Inc. ("AWS") and Microsoft Azure. Information about security provided by AWS is available from the<!-- --> <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://aws.amazon.com/security">AWS Security website</a>. For Azure security information, please visit the<!-- --> <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/overview/security/">Microsoft Azure Security page</a>.</p><p>Greptile uses both OpenAI and Anthropic's API platforms for AI inference. Information about their security practices can be found at the<!-- --> <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://openai.com/enterprise-privacy">OpenAI Enterprise Privacy page</a> <!-- -->and the<!-- --> <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://www.anthropic.com/legal/commercial-terms">Anthropic Commercial Terms page</a>.</p><p>A complete list of third-party service providers that process Customer Data is available on our<!-- --> <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="/security/subprocessors">Subprocessors page</a>. These providers are essential to delivering Greptile's services and are bound by strict data protection requirements and security controls.</p><h3 id="on-premises-self-hosted-services">On-premises (self-hosted) services</h3><p>For self-hosted Greptile services, Custom Apps are hosted using your own infrastructure - such as on-premises - so that you and your users can build, run, and, use Greptile in your virtual private cloud (VPC) or behind your virtual private network (VPN). In provisioning a self-hosted account of the Greptile services, our self-hosted image is built with the latest upstream version of Amazon Linux (Greptile's base operating system image) with the latest security patches and updates.</p><h3>Large Language Model (LLM) Inference</h3><p>Customers that choose to self-host Greptile can choose to also self-host LLMs instead of using OpenAI's API Platform for inference. Customer can also "bring their own LLM" by inserting their own base URL and keys.</p><h3>Storage of Customer Code</h3><p>Greptile stores customer code on an encrypted filesystem on our servers. Code remains cached on our machines until access is revoked in GitHub or GitLab, at which point it is deleted from our servers. Access to the code is tightly controlled and used only to provide the services you have opted into. Greptile also stores vector embeddings of file paths, documentation, and AI-generated docstrings in a vector database.</p><p>For customers using our cloud-based version, code storage occurs on AWS services provisioned by Greptile. If a customer chooses the<!-- --> <strong>on-premises option</strong>, their code never leaves their servers or their provisioned cloud environment.</p><h3>Storage of Customer Data</h3><p>Greptile stores logs of customer chats in an AWS DynamoDB database. Members of the Greptile team may access these chat logs in order to provide technical support. Customers can choose to turn off logging and make chats 100% private. Note that in the self-hosted service, logs are stored on customer servers only.</p><h2 id="machine-learning-and-data-usage">Machine Learning and Data Usage</h2><h3>De-Identified Data and AI Training</h3><p>Greptile may aggregate and anonymize Customer Data ("De-Identified Data") for analytical purposes and to monitor, improve, or expand our services, and may use such data to train and improve artificial intelligence algorithms and models ("AI Training and Learnings").</p><p>Greptile will implement appropriate measures and controls designed to remove personally identifiable information, customer-specific references, and sensitive data from De-Identified Data and AI Training and Learnings. Greptile will solely and exclusively own the De-Identified Data and AI Training and Learnings (but not the underlying Customer Data).</p><h3>Opting Out of AI Training</h3><p>If you do not wish to permit Greptile to engage in AI training, you may manage preferences and settings related to AI training within your account on the Platform, and Greptile will thereafter cease further AI training. For questions about opting out or managing your AI training preferences, please contact <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="mailto:security@greptile.com">security@greptile.com</a>.</p><p>For customers using our <strong>self-hosted solution</strong>, no Customer Data is collected or processed for machine learning purposes unless explicitly configured by the customer.</p><h2 id="confidentiality-and-security-controls">Confidentiality and Security Controls</h2><h3>Confidentiality</h3><p>Greptile places strict controls over its employees' access to Customer Data. The operation of the Greptile requires that some employees have access to the systems which store or process this information and data.</p><p>For example, in order to diagnose a problem the customer are having with the Greptile services, we may need to access the customer's account. These employees are prohibited from using these permissions to view Customer Data unless it is necessary to do so. We have technical controls and audit policies in place to ensure that any access to the customer account is logged.</p><p>All of our employees and contract personnel are bound to our policies regarding confidentiality and we treat these issues as matters of the highest importance within our company.</p><h3>Return and deletion of customer data</h3><p>Within 30 days following any termination or expiration, Customer may request return of Customer Data stored by Greptile (to the extent such data has not already been deleted by Customer).</p><p>Greptile provides the option for administrators to delete all Customer Data stored by Greptile at any time during a subscription term. Within 24 hours of administrator-initiated deletion, Greptile hard deletes all Customer Data from currently running production systems. Greptile-maintained backups of services and data may be destroyed within 30 days (backups are destroyed within 30 days, except that during an on-going investigation of an incident such period may be temporarily extended).</p><h2 id="monitoring-and-validation">Monitoring and Validation</h2><h3>Certificates</h3><p>Greptile is SOC2 Type II compliant. Customers may download a copy of Greptile's SOC2 Type II report by reaching out to <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="mailto:security@greptile.com">security@greptile.com</a>.</p><p>At a minimum, Greptile will align with prevailing industry standards such as SOC 2 Type II, or any successor or superseding standard.</p><h3>Audits</h3><p>To verify that our security practices are sound and to monitor the Greptile services for new vulnerabilities discovered by the security research community, the Greptile services undergo security assessments by internal personnel, and for the Greptile services by respected external security firms who perform regular audits of the Greptile services. In addition to periodic and targeted audits of the Greptile services, we also employ the use of continuous hybrid automated scanning of our web platform. Customers may download a copy of available applicable external audit reports by reaching out to <a class="text-greptile-green hover:underline" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="mailto:security@greptile.com">security@greptile.com</a>.</p><h3>Personnel</h3><p>Greptile conducts background checks on all employees before employment, and employees receive privacy and security training during onboarding as well as on an ongoing basis. All employees are required to read and sign our comprehensive information security policy covering the security, availability, and confidentiality of the Greptile services.</p><h2
